properties.name: camel.component.undertow.allowed-roles
properties.description: Configuration used by UndertowSecurityProvider. Comma separated list of allowed roles.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the undertow component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.host-options
properties.description: To configure common options, such as thread pools. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.undertow.UndertowHostOptions type.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.lazy-start-producer
properties.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.mute-exception
properties.description: If enabled and an Exchange failed processing on the consumer side the response's body won't contain the exception's stack trace.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.security-provider
properties.description: Security provider allows plug in the provider, which will be used to secure requests. SPI approach could be used too (component then finds security provider using SPI). The option is a org.apache.camel.component.undertow.spi.UndertowSecurityProvider type.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: To configure security using SSLContextParameters. The option is a org.apache.camel.support.jsse.SSLContextParameters type.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.undertow-http-binding
properties.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient. The option is a org.apache.camel.component.undertow.UndertowHttpBinding type.

properties.name: camel.component.undertow.use-global-ssl-context-parameters
properties.description: Enable usage of global SSL context parameters.
